Annotation.String: Uniquely identifies the resource within the collection of like resources.
This property represents an identifier for the resource. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.
Provides a description of this resource and is used for commonality in the schema definitions.
This object represents the Description property. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.
The name of the resource or array element.

This object represents the Name property. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification. The value of this string shall be of the format for the reserved word *Name*.
Oem extension object.
This object represents the Oem property. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.
Oem extension object.
This object represents the Oem properties. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.
Base type for an Oem object.
This object represents the base type for an Oem property. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.
This is the base type for resources and referenceable members.
This is the manufacturer/provider specific extension moniker used to divide the Oem object into sections.
The value of this string shall be of the format for the reserved word *Oem*.
This type describes the status and health of a resource and its children.
This type shall contain any status or health properties of a resource.
This indicates the known state of the resource, such as if it is enabled.

This property shall represent if this component is available or not and why. Enabled indicates the resource is available. Disabled indicates the resource has been intentionally made unavailable but it can be enabled. Offline indicates the resource is unavailable intentionally and requires action to be made available. InTest indicates that the component is undergoing testing. Starting indicates that the resource is on its way to becoming available. Absent indicates the resources is physically unavailable.
This represents the overall health state from the view of this resource.
This property shall represent the HealthState of the resource and its dependent resources. The values shall conform to those defined in the Redfish specification.
This represents the health state of this resource in the absence of its dependent resources.
This property shall represent the HealthState of the resource without considering its dependent resources. The values shall conform to those defined in the Redfish specification.
Oem extension object.
This object represents the Oem property. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.
This function or resource has been enabled.
This function or resource has been disabled.
This function or resource is enabled, but awaiting an external action to activate it.
This function or resource is part of a redundancy set and is awaiting a failover or other external action to activate it.
This function or resource is undergoing testing.
This function or resource is starting.
This function or resource is not present or not detected.
This function or resource is present but cannot be used.
The element will not process any commands but will queue new requests.
The element is enabled but only processes a restricted set of commands.
The element is updating and may be unavailable or degraded.
A condition exists that requires attention.
A critical condition exists that requires immediate attention.
Turn the unit on.
Turn the unit off immediately (non-graceful shutdown).
Perform a graceful shutdown and power off.
Perform a graceful shutdown followed by a restart of the system.
Perform an immediate (non-graceful) shutdown, followed by a restart.
Generate a Diagnostic Interrupt (usually an NMI on x86 systems) to cease normal operations, perform diagnostic actions and typically halt the system.
Turn the unit on immediately.
Simulate the pressing of the physical power button on this unit.
Perform a power cycle of the unit.
This type describes any additional identifiers for a resource.
This type shall contain any additional identifiers of a resource.
This type describes the location of a resource.
This type shall describe the location of a resource.
The Indicator LED is lit.

This value shall represent the Indicator LED is in a solid on state. If this value is not supported by the service, the service shall reject PATCH or PUT requests containing this value by returning HTTP 400 (Bad Request).
The Indicator LED is blinking.

This value shall represent the Indicator LED is in a blinking state where the LED is being turned on and off in repetition. If this value is not supported by the service, the service shall reject PATCH or PUT requests containing this value by returning HTTP 400 (Bad Request).
The Indicator LED is off.

This value shall represent the Indicator LED is in a solid off state. If this value is not supported by the service, the service shall reject PATCH or PUT requests containing this value by returning HTTP 400 (Bad Request).
The state is powered On.
The state is powered Off.
A temporary state between Off and On.
A temporary state between On and Off.
This is the base type for addressable members of an array.

Array members can be referenced using the value returned in the @odata.id property which may or may not be a dereferenceable URL. The @odata.id of this entity shall be the location of this element within an Item.
This is the identifier for the member within the collection.
The value of this string shall uniquely identify the member within the collection.
This is the manufacturer/provider specific extension moniker used to divide the Oem object into sections.
The value of this string shall be of the format for the reserved word *Oem*.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
This indicates the world wide, persistent name of the resource.
This property shall contain the world wide unique identifier for the resource. The string shall be in the format described by the value of the Identifier.DurableNameFormat property.
This represents the format of the DurableName property.
This property shall represent the format of the DurableName property.
This indicates the location of the resource.
This property shall represent the location of the resource.

PropertyValue.String: This property has been Deprecated in favor of the PostalAddress, Placement, and PartLocation.

Annotation.String: This represents the format of the Info property.
This property shall represent the format of the Info property.

PropertyValue.String: This property has been Deprecated in favor of the PostalAddress, Placement, and PartLocation.

Annotation.String: Oem extension object.
This object represents the Oem property. All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.
Name Address Authority Format.
This durable name shall be a hexadecimal representation of the Name Address Authority structure as defined in the T11 Fibre Channel - Framing and Signaling - 3 (FC-FS-3) specification.
iSCSI Qualified Name.
This durable name shall be in the iSCSI Qualified Name format as defined in RFC 3720 and RFC 3721.
Fibre Channel World Wide Name.
This durable name shall be a hexadecimal representation of the World Wide Name format as defined in the T11 Fibre Channel Physical and Signaling Interface Specification.
Universally Unique Identifier.

This durable name shall be the hexadecimal representation of the Universal Unique Identifier as defined in the Internation Telecom Union's OSI networking and system aspects - Naming, Addressing and Registration Specification.
IEEE-defined 64-bit Extended Unique Identifier.

This durable name shall be the hexadecimal representation of the IEEE-defined 64-bit Extended Unique Identifier as defined in the IEEE's Guidelines for 64-bit Global Identifier (EUI-64) Specification.
NVMe Qualified Name.
This durable name shall be in the NVMe Qualified Name format as defined in the NVN Express over Fabric Specification.
NVM Namespace Identifier.
This durable name shall be in the NVM Namespace Identifier format as defined in the NVN Express Specification.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to add an abstract base type for Identifier and Location, and to deprecate the versioned definition of IndicatorLED to use an unversioned definition.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
This version contained the former definition of PowerState, which has since been moved to the unversioned namespace.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to add an abstract base type for Identifier and Location, and to deprecate the versioned definition of IndicatorLED and PowerState to use an unversioned definition.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
Defines a rack unit.
Enumeration literals shall name the type of rack units in use.
Defines a rack unit as being equal to 48 mm (1.89 in).
Rack units shall be specifie3d in terms of the Open Compute Open Rack specification.
Defines a rack unit as being equal to 1.75 in (44.45 mm).
Rack units shall be specified as defined by the EIA-310 standard.
The PostalAddress for a resource.
Instances shall describe a postal address for a resource. For more information see RFC5139. Depending on use, the instance may represent a past, current, or future location.
The value shall conform the requirements of the Country field as defined in RFC5139.
A top-level subdivision within a country.
The value shall conform the requirements of the A1 field as defined in RFC5139 when used to name a territory, state, region, province, or prefecture within a country.
A county, parish, gun (JP), or district (IN).
The value shall conform the requirements of the A2 field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to name a county, parish, gun (JP), or district (IN).
City, township, or shi (JP).
The value shall conform the requirements of the A3 field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to name a city, township, or shi (JP).
City division, borough, dity district, ward, chou (JP).
The value shall conform the requirements of the A4 field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to name a city division, borough, dity district, ward, chou (JP).
Neighborhood or block.
The value shall conform the requirements of the A5 field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to name a neighborhood or block.
A leading street direction.
The value shall conform the requirements of the PRD field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to name a leading street direction, (N, W, SE).
Street name.
The value shall conform the requirements of the A6 field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to name a street.
A trailing street suffix.
The value shall conform the requirements of the POD field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to name a trailing street suffix.
Avenue, Platz, Street, Circle.
The value shall conform the requirements of the STS field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to name a street suffix.
Numeric portion of house number.
The value shall conform the requirements of the HNO field as defined in RFC5139. It is the numeric portion of the house number.
House number suffix.
The value shall conform the requirements of the HNS field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to provide a suffix to a house number, (F, B, 1/2).
The value shall conform the requirements of the LMK field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to identify a landmark or vanity address.
Room designation or other additional info.
The value shall conform the requirements of the LOC field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to provide additional information.

PropertyValue.String: This property has been Deprecated in favor of the property AdditionalInfo.

Annotation.String: The value shall conform the requirements of the FLR field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to provide a floor designation.
The value shall conform the requirements of the NAM field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to name the occupant.
Postal code (or zip code).
The value shall conform the requirements of the PC field as defined in RFC5139. The value shall be a Postal code (or zip code).
Name of the building.
The value shall conform the requirements of the BLD field as defined in RFC5139. The value shall be name a building used to locate the resource.
Name or number of the unit (apartment, suite).
The value shall conform the requirements of the UNIT field as defined in RFC5139. The value shall be a name or number of a unit (apartment, suite) used to locate the resource.
Name or number of the room.
The value shall conform the requirements of the ROOM field as defined in RFC5139. The value shall be a name or number of a room used to locate the resource within the unit.
Seat (desk, cubicle, workstation).
The value shall conform the requirements of the SEAT field as defined in RFC5139. The value shall be a name or number of a Seat (desk, cubicle, workstation).
A description of the type of place that is addressed.
The value shall conform the requirements of the PLC field as defined in RFC5139. Examples include: office, residence,...).
Postal community name.
The value shall conform the requirements of the PCN field as defined in RFC5139. The value shall be a postal community name.
Post office box (P.O. box).
The value shall conform the requirements of the POBOX field as defined in RFC5139. The value shall be a Post office box (P.O. box).
Additional code.
The value shall conform the requirements of the ADDCODE field as defined in RFC5139.
A primary road or street.
The value shall conform the requirements of the RD field as defined in RFC5139. The value designates a primary road or street.
Road Section.
The value shall conform the requirements of the RDSEC field as defined in RFC5139. The value shall be a road section.
Road branch.
The value shall conform the requirements of the RDBR field as defined in RFC5139. The value shall be a Post office box (P.O. box)road branch.
Road sub branch.
The value shall conform the requirements of the RDSUBBR field as defined in RFC5139.
Road pre-modifier.
The value shall conform the requirements of the PRM field as defined in RFC5139. (Old, New).
Road post-modifier.
The value shall conform the requirements of the POM field as defined in RFC5139. (Extended).
The GPS coordinates of the part.

The value shall conform the requirements of the ADDCODE field as defined in RFC5139. The value shall be the GPS coordinates of the location. If furnished, this shall be expressed in the format '[-][nn]n.nnnnnn, [-][nn]n.nnnnn', i.e. two numbers, either positive or negative, with six decimal places of precision, comma-separated.

PropertyValue.String: This property has been Deprecated in favor of properties Longitude and Latitude.

Annotation.String: The placement within the addressed location.
The value shall describe a location within a resource. Examples include a shelf in a rack.
Name of row.
The value shall be the name of the row.
Name of a rack location within a row.
The value shall be the name of the rack within a row.
The type of Rack Units in use.
The value shall be a RackUnit enumeration literal indicating the type of rack units in use.
Vertical location of the item in terms of RackOffsetUnits.
Vertical location of the item in the rack. Rack offset units shall be measured from bottom to top starting with 0.
The location of a resource.
Instances shall describe a location for a resource. For more information see RFC5139. Depending on use, the instance may represent a past, current, or future location.
Postal address of the addressed resource.
The value shall be a postal address of the resource.
A place within the addressed location.
The value shall be a place within the addressed location.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to add an abstract base type for Identifier and Location, and to deprecate the versioned definition of IndicatorLED and PowerState to use an unversioned definition.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
This version was created to add PowerCycle enumeration to ResetType.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to add an abstract base type for Identifier and Location, and to deprecate the versioned definition of IndicatorLED and PowerState to use an unversioned definition.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
This version was created to add PartLocation to Location.
Defines the location types for PartLocation.
Enumeration literals shall name the type of location in use.
Defines a slot as the type of location.
Slot shall be used to indicate the type of PartLocation is of type slot.
Defines a bay as the type of location.
Bay shall be used to indicate the type of PartLocation is of type bay.
Defines a connector as the type of location.
Connector shall be used to indicate the type of PartLocation is of type connector.
Defines a socket as the type of location.
Socket shall be used to indicate the type of PartLocation is of type socket.
Defines a reference area for the location of the part.
Enumeration literals shall name the reference for the part location.
Defines the part as being in the top of the unit.
Top shall be used to specify the part location is in the top of the unit.
Defines the part as being in the bottom of the unit.
Top shall be used to specify the part location is in the bottom of the unit.
Defines the part as being in the front of the unit.
Top shall be used to specify the part location is in the front of the unit.
Defines the part as being in the rear of the unit.
Top shall be used to specify the part location is in the rear of the unit.
Defines the part as being in the left of the unit.
Top shall be used to specify the part location is in the left of the unit.
Defines the part as being in the right of the unit.
Top shall be used to specify the part location is in the right of the unit.
Defines the part as being in the middle of the unit.
Top shall be used to specify the part location is in the middle of the unit.
Defines a orientation for the ordering of the ordinal value of the part location.
Enumeration literals shall name the orientation for the location type ordering in determining the LocationOrdinalValue.
Defines the ordering for the LocationOrdinalValue is front to back.
This value shall be used to specify the ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is front to back.
Defines the ordering for the LocationOrdinalValue is back to front.
This value shall be used to specify the ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is back to front.
Defines the ordering for the LocationOrdinalValue is top to bottom.
This value shall be used to specify the ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is top to bottom.
Defines the ordering for the LocationOrdinalValue is bottom to top.
This value shall be used to specify the ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is bottom to top.
Defines the ordering for the LocationOrdinalValue is left to right.
This value shall be used to specify the ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is left to right.
Defines the ordering for the LocationOrdinalValue is right to left.
This value shall be used to specify the ordering for LocationOrdinalValue is right to left.
The part location within the placement.
The value shall describe a location within a resource. This representation shall be used to indicate the location within the Placement.
This is the label of the part location, such as a silk screened name or a printed label.
The value shall be the label assigned for service at the part location.
The type of location of the part, such as slot, bay, socket and slot.
The value shall be a LocationType enumeration literal indicating the type of rack units in use.
The number that represents the location of the part. If LocationType is slot and this unit is in slot 2 then the LocationOrdinalValue will be 2.
The value shall be the number that represents the location of the part based on the LocationType. LocationOrdinalValue shall be measured based on the Orientation value starting with 0.
The reference point for the part location. This is used to give guidance as to the general location of the part.
The value shall be a Reference enumeration literal indicating the general location within the unit of the part.
The orientation for the ordering of the slot enumeration used by the LocationOrdinalValue property.
The value shall be a Orientation enumeration literal indicating the orientation for the ordering used by the LocationOrdinalValue property.
The part location within the placement.
The value shall describe a location within a resource. This representation shall be used to indicate the location within the Placement.
This version was created to add an abstract base type for Identifier and Location, and to deprecate the versioned definition of IndicatorLED and PowerState to use an unversioned definition.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
This version was created to add GPS Coordinated to Location and enumerations for DurableNameFormat for NVMe fabric extension.
The longitude resource in degrees.
The value shall be the longitude of the resource specified in degrees using a decimal format and not minutes or seconds.
The latitude resource.
The value shall be the latitude of the resource specified in degrees using a decimal format and not minutes or seconds.
The altitude of the resource in meters.
The altitude of the resource in meters.

This version was created to correct the permissions for Longitude, Latitude, and AltitudeMeters inside the Location object. It was also created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
This version was created to add an array of Contact Information entries to Location, and to deprecate Location within PostalAddress in favor of AdditionalInfo.
Array of contact information.
The value shall contain contact information used to obtain more information from an individual or organization responsible for this resource.
Room designation or other additional info.
The value shall conform the requirements of the LOC field as defined in RFC5139. It is used to provide additional information.
Area designation or other additional info.

The value shall contain additional information, such as Tile, Column (Post), Wall, or other designation used to describe a location that cannot be conveyed with other properties defined for the Placement object.
Contact information for this resource.
This object shall contain contact information used to obtain more information from an individual or organization responsible for this resource.
Name of this contact.
The value shall contain the name of a person or organization to contact for information about this resource.
Phone number for this contact.
The value shall contain the phone number for a person or organization to contact for information about this resource.
Email address for this contact.
The value shall contain the email address for a person or organization to contact for information about this resource.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation.
This version was created to to add the Redfish Excerpt annotation to the Name property.
